result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keonte Davon McGhee

Defendant Keonte D McGhee in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg in court for Keonte D McGhee.  Attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea hearing.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg in court, defendant Keonte D McGhee not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing remains scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg in court, defendant Keonte Davon McGhee not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference.  State informs the court of a global offer.  Defense requests a projected plea date and bail/bond hearing.  Court scheduled the matters as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg in court, defendant Keonte D McGhee not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a status.  Defense requests another status date.  Court allows ONE MORE status.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Keonte D McGhee in court, via zoom, with Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Defendant Keonte D McGhee in custody.  Stephanie Krueger on behalf of Amanada Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM.   Case set for bail/bond hearing. Bail motion by Defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  All conditions remain the same. Defense awaiting additional disocvery and global offer and request a status conference. Case adjourned, Branch 40 - via zoom.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Keonte Davon McGhee in court with Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Defendant Keonte Davon McGhee in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case called upon request from the parties. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Amount: $20.00

Defendant Keonte Davon McGhee not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Preliminary hearing. State Public Defenders Office needs more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
ENTRY MADE ON 04/04/2022 IS CORRECTED TO READ: Court ordered cash bail set in amount of $7,500.00. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.

Court ordered no contact with C.J.H
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Keonte Davon McGhee in court with attorney David Thomas Conley.  Defendant Keonte Davon McGhee in custody.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keonte Davon McGhee appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case retabbed to Branch 40
Lower number cases pending.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense in Count 1 a sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4).  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
